name: Remont Oxford Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time in a year that we stayed at the Remont, and the hotel and its staff were just as great as we remembered them. The rooms are stylishly decorated (no brown floral patterns in sight) and ultra clean, with nice bathrooms (great shower!) and flatscreen TV. The beds are wonderful. The breakfast buffet was good, with both hot and cold options to choose from. The staff are friendly, helpful and forthcoming without being all over you, and we had a very pleasant and relaxing stay.
reviews.title: Consistently great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only small minus is that it's not slap bang in the centre of town, but as it's only a 10 min bus ride and the bus stop is a few metres down the road this is a very small minus indeed.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent just one night in this cozy place which is located very convenientely to the city center. The service has been accurate, carried out in a very 'familiar' manner, with no frills but absolutely comfortable and reliable.
reviews.title: Boutique chic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms (16 & 17) - although not very big, they were very quiet (rear view) and gently decorated, clean, comfortable and fully equipped with TV set, table and desk (if you need to work), a nice queen size bed etc. Amazing large shower in both bathrooms
reviews.title: Stay away!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location - just a couple of miles away from the city center, you can either get on a bus which will take you in the most famous zones in three/four stops or drive till any of the main parking area located in very heart of the city. If you like to walk, you can even take a big breath and spend 20/25 minutes going through shops, lovely colleges and much more.
reviews.title: A good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly I would like to say that this is not a BAD hotel, however looking at previous reviews I feel a little perspective is required. Yes the hotel is very clean, and the breakfast is very good. However, the location is not great mainly due to the hotel being situated right on a noisy main road opposite some fairly drab buildings. I feel more effort could've been made by the owners to shield the hotel from this, eg: with trees at the front of the building? Also whilst the rooms are indeed spotlessly clean, they are very dull. If pure brilliant white (everywhere) is your thing, then this is the place for you, however I thought the hotel lacked character and felt a bit like a visit to my local dental surgery. I don't want to be too critical as the hotel is decent and represents reasonable value when compared with some of the other overpriced Oxford alternatives, however I'm not sure it warrants the high ratings received on Tripadvisor. Maybe my expectation was just raised too much?
reviews.title: The no. 1 rated hotel in Oxford?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very well looked after at the Remont from the moment we arrived. We arrived before check-in time, but were given a room almost immediately. It was further out from Oxford centre than we had anticipated, but there are bus stops both to and from the city a few steps away. There is no bar or restaurant at the Remont but it's only a 5 minute walk from the centre of Summertown, which is well equipped with both. The hotel is spotlessly clean - white, cool, beautifully finished. A little gem.
reviews.title: beautifully kept, lovely staff, great breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and comfortable and breakfast excellent. The bed was superb and all in all it is a good place to say, although it is not the cheapest. It is on a major road into Oxford and the road noise was disturbing. So ask for a room facing the back. This noise factor is the reason we did not give it an "excellent"
reviews.title: Great, but ask for a room facing back of house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Free Wifi worked well.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Remont

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The bus ride into the city is very convenient and there is no need to use a car to visit the sites once you are here. Staff were friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Good Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed here one night for a business trip - we found that it was a little far out of Oxford - a good 20 minute drive into town in fact one trip took 1 1/2 hours due to traffic sadly. The room was well appointed but there was a lot of irritating noise from the uncarpeted areas outside the room. Would probably stay again - breakfast was great!
reviews.title: Nice modern but a little far out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have traveled to Oxford every three weeks over the past school year. We've stayed at 6 places (two other guest houses) and three other hotels. We stayed at Remont on our last trip for the first time. It was physically the nicest place to stay. Admittedly also more expensive than the others. Rooms were very nice (they have two categories larger and smaller). Decor was extremely well done. Parking was good. Location very good for our needs. Not a hotel, but more comfy than a hotel. Nice breakfast choices. We are returning to stay there on our next trip. If you are in Oxford, don;t miss Bicester Village Factory Outlet. (Busses run from Oxford - taxis are a bit costly to get there and back). Easy if you have a car. Great prices. Bangkok House and Chiang Mai both nice Thai restaurants. Very good value Chinese Restaurant on Banbury Road a short distance from the Remont towards town. In Summertown the Portabello Restaurant (on South Parade - off Banbury Road also only a short distance away) is a nice lunchtime or dinner time place, with a good pizzeria next store. Closer in to town several restuarants worth trying - Lock Fyne in Jerico area, Cafe Rouge near by. We were told that the Aziz restaurant off Banbury Road (I think North Parade St) was best Indian around.
reviews.title: Nicest of 6 Places We've Stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The owners of this excellent B&B on the outskirts of Oxford have done wonders in transforming two detached houses into a boutique hotel. We booked two rooms, both were very nicely decorated with some interesting artwork and extremely well appointed bathrooms. Everywhere is spotlessly clean. The purpose built breakfast room is bright and airy. The garden is well kept with nice tables and chairs for guests to use. Breakfast was outstanding with everything freshly prepared and constantly replenished. Infinitely better than staying in the centre as you also have plenty of free parking, with either a bus ride or probably a 10-15 mins walk. There are a number of restaurants in Summertown or you are a 5 mins drive from an excellent gastropub - The Trout.
reviews.title: A great find in a wonderful city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Remont has nice, well-appointed rooms and with fabulous, spacious bathrooms. Breakfast was very good. We only stayed for a one night stopover and did not travel into Oxford. The hotel has easy and plentiful parking (the main reason we stayed here). We did go into Summertown and can highly recommend Spice Lounge for modern Indian.
reviews.title: nice - would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night and can really recommend this charming hotel. Quiet and comfortable room, very good breakfast and only 12 minutes by bus to the citycenter, where parking is "impossible". In Oxford we had a very good meal at the Thai Restaurant Chieng may;
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR VISITING OXFORD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Remont after finding it at No 1 on the Trip advisor site and it definitely deserves the acclamation. We found the service to be very friendly, the hotel interior very modern and clean, breakfast was well catered for all needs and the hotel room itself was lovely. The only drawback was that it was a hot weekend and there was no way to keep the room cool without opening the windows and therefore you would hear the road noise. There is a fan in the room but this just moves the warm air around. Overall had a good nights sleep anyway. Would definitely go back and stay here.
reviews.title: Brilliantly well run hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: Taking my visiting parents around the UK meant that we had to find rooms suitable for 3 adults--not always an easy task! But the Remont delivered, with a lovely room full of character and cosiness. Bear in mind the lift doesn't always work--it tried to lock us in--and the top floor requires taking the stairs anyway, but once you've made it to the room you won't want to leave anyway! Greeted by lovely warm decor, soft beds, and tea and biscuits. The breakfast is labelled "buffet" but is actually a full English if you want it, and served in a sunny room by attentive staff. It is a bit out of the main way, but is only a short bus ride from the centre of town.
reviews.title: Very relaxing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: One word of caution: there are two different bus companies in Oxford, and buying a day pass to one won't get you on the other. I recommend the blue Stagecoach, as the drivers are nice and friendly and help you out when you get hopelessly lost, while Oxford Bus Company apparently enjoy shouting at hapless tourists. (Honestly, was shouting at my mother really necessary? But that was not anything to do with the hotel--just make sure you pick the right bus to get there!) The 2 or the 7 should get you out to Squitchey Lane, where you find a building that looks like a house, and that's where you want to go! The buses do fortunately run quite late, so you can head into Oxford and enjoy yourself and still get back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Remont, a good B&B that could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There’s plenty to like about Remont, but still some work to do to become the boutique hotel it aspires to. At present they are a very good B&B let down by an uncomfortable bed and no evening dining facilities which makes their rack rates a tad high. That said, and if we ignore the poor night’s sleep down to the tired mattress, this is a very nice place to stay. Remont has free parking (very important for Oxford), a pleasant garden, reasonable location, scrupulously clean rooms, and welcoming communal areas all wrapped in superb friendly service. We really liked Remont, and feel really bad (a bit like kicking a puppy) in criticising such a friendly operation, but whilst it’s a nice place it’s doesn’t quite match up to their own billing. For more info, the guest house’s own website http://www.remont-oxford.co.uk/ is fairly accurate and worth a look.
reviews.title: Immaculate boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: LOCATION – Remont is situated in Summertown about 3 miles outside Oxford on the busy A4165 Banbury Road. Oxford centre is a £1.85, 15 min bus ride from a stop less than 100 yards away. The bus service is frequent and reliable.
reviews.title: Great hotel as a base for Oxford

description: A recently renovated boutique styled accommodation in the picturesque city of Oxford.
